list_definition.mean_english: sự xấu hổ, sự tủi thẹn
list_definition.definition: (often with at) an unpleasant feeling caused by awareness of guilt, fault, foolishness or failure

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I was full of shame at my rudeness
He felt no shame at his behaviour/behavior.
The news that he had accepted bribes brought shame on his whole family.

list_definition.definition: (with a) a cause of disgrace or a matter for blame

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It’s a shame to treat a child so cruelly.
What a shame that he didn’t get the job!

list_definition.definition: (often with into) to force or persuade to do something by making ashamed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was shamed into paying his share.

list_definition.definition: to cause to have a feeling of shame

list_ex_of_english: As to naming and shaming after the event, there are 50,000 authorities.
We have not made a commitment on naming and shaming.
If we do not take that on board, understand it, and be shamed by it, we shall get nowhere.
The thing that has been most distressing has been the virtual 'naming and shaming' of vegetables and then declaring them not guilty.
To do that in pursuit of savings which, in terms of global expenditure, are puny, shames us.
If the naming and shaming through publishing the lists does not achieve that, perhaps statutory deadlines may be required.
We must determine who was responsible and these people must be named and shamed.
We are afraid of having a 'witch-hunt' when naming and shaming is carried out.
